data.title: Pies, Cookies, and Quiche, oh my!
data.text: And boy do they do pie! Stumbled across Upper Crust after strolling through the Farmer's Market. Saw a dozen or more happy people sitting outside and in with pie in their hands, in their mouths, and on their faces. I immediately wanted some of that joy, so I went inside. So. Many. Pies. So many choices, Omg what to do! I bought a peanut butter cookie, a slice of Bumble Berry pie, and what's pie without coffee... (It was good coffee, by the way). Dang! Out of bumble berry. I dared to be adventurous and try gooseberry for the first time ever. It was tart (no pun intended), which was a perfect counter-balance to the sweet crust. Normally I don't eat pie crust because I've never found one that was good enough to eat by itself (like my Grammy used to make). Crusts are usually either too dense, too chewy, or woefully bland. But the pie crust at Upper Crust rocks! It was amazing. It was almost like a pastry by itself: flaky, but doesn't fly everywhere when you bite into it; light but substantive, mildly sweet and flavorful. Very nice place to stop for pie and coffee after a hard day of shopping. Or to begin a hard day of shopping.

data.title: Cookies to Change Your Life :)
data.text: We love, love, love the banana cookies - a stop in downtown OP isn't complete without stopping here for a snack.  The pies are amazing - they are my go to hostess gift.  Fantastic and friendly staff.  Support your local KC businesses :)

data.title: Cookies are fantastic!
data.text: This was our first visit to the upper crust and great!  We got a few cookies and we both thought they were very yummy!!  I wanted to get a pie, but we were traveling...next time!

data.title: Pie Heaven
data.text: Pies are delish.. We bought two to go and the banana pie was delicious.  I recommend this place if you want to try a great piece of home made pie.  They close early like at four so get your pies early. LOL

data.title: Get Your Pie On
data.text: Pies so good that Grandma just hung up her apron and is sitting at the next table.  These two ladies make the most heavenly pies and cookies I've ever tasted.  It's all fresh and made from scratch.  The selection of pies change regularly so stop in frequently.  Their cookies are equally terrific, try the molasses or the burnt sugar banana cookie.  The shop is very welcoming and the smells enticing.  They do this wonderful thing on 3rd Fridays, Pie Flights - 3 slices of pies for $7.  Mark your calendar.

data.title: Wish I Could Visit Every Day
data.text:
In a perfect world, I would be able to visit Upper Crust every morning (and on the occasional afternoon).

The pie is first rate and a perfectly acceptable breakfast, particularly if you choose a slice of an oatmeal variety or order some quiche. The cookies are divine (get the banana with brown sugar icing and a sugar cookie, too). The Thou Mayest coffee is rich and bold.

And the atmosphere is simply lovely --- like sitting on a stylish neighbor's front porch (a neighbor that makes a killer pie). The decor is simple and creative -- vintage and reimagined items as a beautiful backdrop to home goods and pie memorabilia available for sale.

Stop in. You will love it.

data.title: Awesome pies and cookies
data.text:
I love stopping by here even for the smells.  They have various sizes and flavors to choose from, small pies, whole pies and slices.  Loved them when they were located in Prydes and love them here as well.  Love the little pies, perfect for two people. 
Remember that they are closed Sunday-Tuesday!

data.title: Great oh so great
data.text: I have been many times and I am always satisfied! The best pie and the best cookies! Try any of their wonderful treats and you will be very happy you did!!!!

data.title: Worth all the calories
data.text: We had the carmel apple pie and the chocolate pie - both were amazing.  We had dessert while shopping the great little dog friendly neighborhood.  Charming place that kind of takes you back in time.  Cookies are also available and they offered tasting samples.  The snicker doodle and pecan bars were excellent.

data.title: Excellent Pies - At a Price
data.text: Cherry pie is delicious, but at 30 bucks a pie, it is a bit too pricey for me. A small single lemon meringue set us back 8, but it was pleasing to the eye and the palate.

data.title: Best pies in KC!
data.text: These are the best pies in Kansas City hands down.  I love the bumbleberry and strawberry rhubarb best.  Inside is so adorable and feels like a hip version of grandma's kitchen.

data.title: Great pie!
data.text: Love the banana cookies with burnt sugar frosting and German chocolate pie!!  Lots of pies to choose from. Banana and coconut cream are also great too!

data.title: A true slice of heaven
data.text:
If you like pie you have to go to the upper crust in Overland Park 
 I have never experienced pie crust that is perfect it's addicting 
 Every pie is handmade with fresh ingredients the app was my number one choice    cherry is made with tart cherries but the blueberry is to die for 
 A little bit pricey but definitely a special occasion treat 
 They have small pies that are single serving if you want to try now a selection 
 You can't go wrong with any flavors    order ahead of time they sell out almost every day 
 The only problem is parking.  finding a parking place on a Saturday go early

data.title: Serious deliciousness!
data.text: My daughter and I were strolling around downtown Overland Park and couldn't pass up the amazing smells coming through the screen door.  This place is so adorable!   Let me start by saying this place isn't cheap, but you will NOT be disappointed.  Their pies come in two sizes (regular or individual) or by the slice.  You name it, they have it.  My daughter got an individual blueberry pie for a friend.  She heard it was "really, really, really good!"  They also have yummy cookies.  I got the kids a snickerdoodle and a molasses.  Their only comment was, "when are you going back for more?"  I got a salted pecan bar, which was huge.  I cut it up and it lasted several days.  It was amazing!   We will definitely be back soon!

data.title: Cakes is for Sissies!!!
data.text:
Oh goodness me...can you stand it.  A cafe/shop totally devoted to pie!!!  Well we couldn't resist and we are glad we didn't. 

First of all, the place is just so super cute!  Small, quaint, cute decor, retro.  Second, the service was awesome.  The staff made us feel so welcomed and like family.  They offered their own reviews of the fave pies...and they gave us a sample.  Love that. Third, the offerings were amazing...rhubarb/strawberry, sugar cream, coconut cream, chocolate cream...apple of course...amazing stuff.  

We ordered a slice of three different pies a la mode of course...and shared...wow...we were all so impressed...and the tea was great!!!  One should NOT miss this adorable and palate pleasing eatery.

P.S.  Can't speak about the men's room, but the ladies room was a feast for the eyes.

data.title: Best Pie Ever!
data.text: If you are on a diet and have been able to resist all other temptations then don't even go near this place.  Not only is the pie extraordinary but the cookies and pecan bars are the best!

data.title: Amazing pie and friendly service
data.text: Frequently visit this pie shop when in the neighborhood for a cookie or slice of pie, and coffee. Warm friendly atmosphere to sit and enjoy  coffee and pie. The ladies behind the counter can't be beat. They give wonderful suggestion about their products. Highly recommend you give them a try. It's a fun place to be.

data.title: Best Pies in KC hands down!!
data.text: LOCALLY owned bakery. Pies are EXCELLENT!! Not cheap but when you want the best this is the place. Very friendly staff too. Have never been disappointed with their products. Other bakery items for sale too. Open Wed-Friday 10-530PM Saturday 1000AM-400PM

data.title: Pie? Why yes please.
data.text: If you like pie then this is the place. Great pies here and they do them right. Nice flaky crust, delicious fruit fillings & mile high meringue. Great cookies and super friendly service. Only wish they put a bit more filling in their small pies. But the taste is awesome.
